title: An e-teaching site to train radiologists across India -
text:
BENGALURU: An innovative e-teaching initiative was launched today by a Bengaluru based medical company in collaboration with National Board of Medical Examiners, to offer online radiology education to post graduate radiology graduates across the country through its flagship e-learning portal, www.radguru.net. 

Dr Arjun Kalyanpur, CEO and chief radiologist of Teleradiology Solutions, who has played a vital role in developing the e-learning site, said: "There is an acute shortage of radiologists in our country. Only 10,000 of them for a population of 1.2 billion are not adequate. So we decided to set up this online teaching portal so that one doctor can train multiple residents on one go. It will be having visiting professors from Europe and United States in addition to Indian faculty." 

Radguru.Net is a comprehensive and collaborative learning platform with live case discussions, quizzes and an archive of interesting cases. It also includes guest lectures by eminent national and international faculty from institutions such as Yale, UMass, Baylor and Harvard. 

Registration is free on their site.
